title: Five children a day caught with knives in schools, police figures reveal
text:
Children are being caught with knives in schools up to five times a day, figures reveal.

Police data shows that weapons involved in offences in schools range from zombie and kitchen knives to a sword, machete and a meat cleaver as well as “adapted” blades including a fidget spinner fitted with a spike to be used to cause harm.

Knives have been involved in 1,260 incidents since April 2017, according to the figures released by police to the Press Association under freedom of information laws. That is equivalent to five cases for every day of the English school year.

It comes amid a surge in knife crime with offences rising to 43,516 in the year ending March 2019, an 80 per cent increase from the low point in 2014 when there were 23,945 offences. This is the highest since comparable data began being compiled in 2011.

Geoff Barton, general secretary of the Association of School and College Leaders, said: "The scourge of weapons has grown worse in recent years, and while there are a number of complex factors involved, a key issue has been cuts in policing and local support services for vulnerable families.

"Gangs have filled this vacuum and often pressure and groom young people into dealing drugs and carrying weapons. Schools are doing their best to tackle these problems, but they cannot possibly solve this issue on their own.”
description: Children are being caught with knives in schools up to five times a day, figures reveal.
